meta.purpose: Chaos-mode proof concept scaffold for P vs NP using interacting lemma graph, audits, locality, and monotone extraction.

lemmas.scope: Circuits with input-only negations; ≤t negated variables
lemmas.statement: Under R_p (variable restrictions), circuit becomes monotone on live variables with prob ≥ (1-p)^t.
lemmas.proof: Each negated variable survives live with prob p; monotone iff none survive => (1-p)^t.

lemmas.statement: Pr[some NOT survives] ≤ t_NOT * (r^2/2)*(m/n)^2 (using ≤1 surviving vertex in support implies const).
lemmas.proof: Bound event that ≥2 support vertices remain; union bound over pairs; union bound over NOT gates.

lemmas.scope: Self-reduction tester for SAT under distribution D_n
lemmas.statement: If f passes SR checks w.p. ≥1-δ and passes witness-checks for YES outputs, then f is close to SAT under D_n.
blockers: OR-based SR lacks group structure; classical BLR/Fourier methods don't apply directly.
Need new analytic invariant (e.g., martingale, monotone coupling, or fixed-point stability).

lemmas.scope: Sparse CNFs with disjoint variable sets
lemmas.statement: If f(φ_A ∧ φ_B) ≈ f(φ_A) ∧ f(φ_B) for random disjoint pairs and also passes SR checks, then f is support-local (junta-like).
blockers: Need quantitative junta theorem for non-product domains (formula space).
Need distribution D_n with enough random disjoint decompositions and closure under SR moves.

lemmas.scope: GapCLIQUE / CLIQUE monotone LBs under vertex restriction
lemmas.statement: Monotone lower bounds scale with m (vertices) so apply after restricting to induced subgraph on m vertices.
lemmas.status: mostly-ok (depends on exact known LB regime)
lemmas.notes: This is the cleanest robustness route because restriction maps problem instance to smaller same-type instance.

lemmas.scope: SAT -> graph problem preserving disjoint unions and SR-friendly variable operations
lemmas.statement: Reduction R maps CNF formulas to graphs such that: (i) SR on formula corresponds to local edits in graph; (ii) disjoint union corresponds to graph product/union; (iii) satisfiable/unsat maps to clique-gap property.
blockers: Standard reductions (SAT->CLIQUE) do not preserve disjoint union as simple graph union in a way compatible with gap versions.
Need gadgetization that is compositional under conjunction on disjoint vars.
